page.title: 12Farming
page.content: The farm of LINDEAN was a tenanted farm until 1913, when its buildings and fixed equipment were compulsorily acquired-under the provisions of a new Smallholders (SCOTLAND) ACT- by the then Board of Agriculture and resold to 13 smallholders selected by the Board. The farmlands remained the property of the "laird", who received annual rents.The original acres were divided into holdings varying in size between 7 and 170 acres.To provide a dwelling for each smallholder 5 new houses were built.With small adjustments these arrangements continued until the 1960's,when 8 of the holdings were sold and reconstituted as a ring-fence farm of 340 acres. Only one of the original holdings survives in anything like its planned size and fulfilling its initial purpose.
